title: Is there a reason, 5 years later, Yas can still ult other knockbacks?
body: I don't understand why getting in Range of Nautilus or Vi ult gets to mean you just insta die if they have a Yas.  Who thinks of this garbage.  Stop overloading "skillfull champs" with so many damn crutches, and give them a fucking mana bar.

replies.body: Because otherwise his knockup would have to be *far* more accessible in a teamfight for him to ever be useful...?

You mean a "high skill" champ would actually have to properly setup their ult rather than just mash R on who they want to die?  He already has no cooldowns and infinite mana, they could at least restrict his ult a tiny bit.

It's restricted by requiring a knockup and putting him right in the middle of the enemy team as a squishy.

Most knockups are fairly short in duration, to the point where you sometimes can't actually ult off of them once you consider normal human reflexes and ping.

And how the fuck is he going to set up for his knockup when the only way he's getting it is the minions his team is automatically mindlessly clearing before the fight?
He can hit champions with Q too
Yeah, no. Not happening in a major 5v5 fight. He would be dead before he got the 3rd Q off, unless someone was so far out of position that yasuo didnt matter, anyone could take advantage of it.
He has infinite dashes and a wind wall... wind wall is better than most ults

Infinite dashes.... Which require an enemy target with a CD per target... Not very infinite if theres a finite number of restricted uses.

Windwall.... Is not better than most ults. It blocks projectiles from passing through, and thats it. A strong defensive move for a squishy melee with very limited capability to close the gap on his own. Not to mention yas loses to most melee matchups quite handily.
Did you miss the part about where he's squishy as fuck and is going to get his ass combo'd to death if he tries to stack Q on champions?

> Did you miss the part about where he's squishy as fuck and is going to get his ass combo'd to death if he tries to stack Q on champions?

ROFL 

Ever heard about his disgusting autoshield or his even more disgusting windwall? 

"he's squishy as fuck" xDxDxD

You mean the shield that lasts a second and usually dies to two hits from most abilities? And the wall that roughly half of attacks go through, including the attacks that are the biggest threat to him?

He can have all the windwalls he wants Darius is still going to kill him before he hits the ground after Darius presses E. As are nearly all juggernauts or assassins, and if you're not seeing juggernauts or assassins in almost every game on your team then you're not at a tier where you have to worry about Yasuo.

And that's just the classes that counter him. That's not even considering the fact that **no fucking ADC is dumb enough to stand on top of his fucking wall**.

they are different in specificity, but you have not at all explained why you think it's broken or should be removed or would be a healthy change for the balance of the champion.

Cass empowering E with other poisons is more of a gimmick than anything.  There are so few champions with poison the interaction will rarely come into play.  In addition Cass can already poison her own targets very easily with her spammable Q and large W.  Lastly, the consequence of being poisoned by another champ means if Cass is within her short range, she will deal more damage.  Not instant death.  

Yasuo can jump in from almost a full screen away, refresh his shield, gain armor pen, deal damage, and extend the duration of any CC.  Not only does this mean instant death for anyone within a screen of Yasuo, all he had to do was point and click R once.

Kai'Sa should hardly be used as a model of balanced gameplay.  She was given the ally interaction not because she needed it but so she can make LC$ big plays with her support.  She didn't get to be the #1 ADC in pick rate by being fair and balanced.
Have you considered that ulting off a teammate's displacement ability was the primary intent, with his own Q3 being more of a backup system?

Fuck he even gets the ult off of MINOR knockups, like Pyke hook. It's ridiculous. It should only procc on abilities that primarily have knockups as the main thing, and NOT if a knockup is just a small part of it.

He has crazy mobility near minions/in teamfights, he has crazy initiation range with minium setup, he can use his mobility on top of a shield and windwall to mitigate damage.

He is literally the most cancerous and overloaded champion to play against.
I do not have a problem with his ult at all, its the other parts of his kit that are problematic like the double crit passive and windwall.

Tbh I understand and am fine with him being abke to use it off of stuff like Nautilus R, Vi R, Ornn R, etc. As long as yknow, they're actual knockups.

What I don't agree with is the fact that shit like Nautilus hook and Darius pull count as "airborne" for his ult
Legit got ulted by Yasuo last week after this Darius pulled me. Ffs, I don't understand why he gets to ult me over a pseudo hook.

I mean, tbh I hardly ever use ult on other peoples' knockups, I use that as an opportunity to dash around the fight, stack Q and THEN use my ult, since that allows me to be in control of the fight. Even when I do use Yas' ult it's moreso because I have to in order to guarantee an unclean kill from a forced gank than to actually be useful.

To be completely honest they could get rid of it and Yasuos would still do incredibly well since his knockup is _really_ accessible, especially once you master the E->Q cooldown refund trick.

"Keep Yasuo Strong"
Rule number one of the "balance" team for Riot.

Also, the problem is they have overtuned the champions that are traditionally considered difficult.
Yasuo has never had a particularly high skill floor, regardless of what people scream about him. He is really deceptively easy to play.
However, with the overtuning of champions that once were niche (because they were hard and extremely powerful if you mastered them), they have all but removed the skill-floor from League of Legends.

Riven, Vayne, and Thresh, all having an incredibly good win-rate at low levels for long periods of time are just a few of the examples.
They used to be difficult but now, just push buttons and aim kinda in the right direction and you will get free wins.
His ult should be single target and/or it should not extend the duration of CC for targets beyond the first. It's too broken with things like Ori ult or Malphite ult.

You mean 7 years later?

Also, yes there is a reason, he would be straight up useless in teamfights if he couldn't.
That would be an improvement to the game's overall quality.
